snippet: François Hollande became the first Socialist president of France since 1981, but his victory over Nicolas Sarkozy will also be seen as a challenge to the policy of austerity in the euro zone.
abstract: Francois Hollande defeats French Pres Nicolas Sarkozy, becoming the first Socialist elected president of France since Francois Mitterand; Sarkozy becomes the latest European leader to lose his post amid economic upheaval and the first French incumbent to be rejected since 1981.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Maïa de la Baume in Tulle, France, and Scott Sayare, Elvire Camus, Palko Karasz, Eleanor Stanford, Roswana Khan and Meghan Davidson in Paris.

lead_paragraph: François Hollande became the first Socialist president of France since 1981, but his victory over Nicolas Sarkozy will also be seen as a challenge to the policy of austerity in the euro zone.

headline.main: Hollande Ousts Sarkozy in French Presidential Election
headline.print_headline: Socialist Wins French Election Against Sarkozy
headline.sub: Sarkozy Concedes to Socialist Challenger in Crucial Runoff
